Versatile Stance

Requirement: A weapon with the Versatile trait.

Weapon in hand, you place your off-hand at the ready to switch to two hands and back again, ready to use the right grip for the right moment.

Pros

Spry Strike

  • When entering this stance, and at the start of each turn in this stance, pick whether to wield your weapon in one or two hands, or to put it away.
    • One hand: Move up either one spot in the initiative order. If you just switched from two-handed, also gain either an additional minor action.
    • Two hands: Move down one spot in the initiative order, but double your Strength or Dexterity modifier when dealing damage with this weapon. If you just switched from one-hand, also double your Strength or Dexterity model for attack rolls with this weapon.

Footwork

  • As a minor action, while holding your weapon in one hand, you can disengage, trip, or hide.

Follow Through

  • As a minor action, your next two-handed attack this turn increases its die size by one.

Cons

Sticky Hands

  • You cannot switch or stow weapons, or change stance or handedness, outside of the Versatility ability.

Lacking Defense

  • Ending your turn with one hand on your weapon lowers your AC by -2 until the beginning of your next turn.

Stiff Defense

  • Ending your turn with two hands on your weapon lowers your Strength (Save), Dexterity (Save), and Constitution (Save) by -4 until the beginning of your next turn.
